class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A deputy observed a vehicle driving in an erratic manner. The deputy initiated traffic stop and the vehicle pulled into a parking lot. The vehicle continued through the parking lot and then turned on CountrySide Boulevard. During the pursuit it was learned the vehicle was involved in a reported car jacking (See C2009001824). The vehicle continued to flee then lost control of the vehicle ran into a median and into the opposite lanes where it stopped. The driver then attempted to flee on foot but was apprehended by a Loudoun County SheriffÕs Office K9 unit. Victor Manuel Quinteros 21 of Sterling was charged with Robbery (car jacking) DUI driving on a revoked license disregarding a signal to stop.

The complainant was waiting at a traffic signal at the listed located when she looked over and saw the front passenger of another vehicle pointing at firearm in their direction. As the suspect vehicle drove away the passenger appeared to pull the trigger of the weapon. The suspect vehicle was located in the area of Manning Square. A BB gun was located inside the residence where the vehicle was located. Two 16-year-old males from Sterling and a 17-year-old from Fairfax were identified as being involved in the incident. The two 16-year-olds were charged with brandishing a firearm discharging a firearm from a vehicle and missile at an occupied vehicle. One of the 16-year-olds was also charged with possession of an altered ID. Both juveniles are being held at the Loudoun County Juvenile Detention Center. Petitions are possible against the 17-year-old. He was released to the custody of his parents. C2009003966

The substance was brought into the building and disposed of prior to contacting authorities. Fire and rescue personnel from Arcola South Riding Moorefield as well as Fairfax County and Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority were called to the scene. Since the product had been disposed of near the facilities air-intake system the children and staff members were evacuated from the building as a precaution. class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Deputies responded to a report a child possibly struck by a vehicle

During the investigation it was determined the child was running to a school bus that was preparing to stop when he ran out in front of a car. The car came to a stop and the child put out his hand. The driver stayed at the scene until the bus left the area. The child arrived at school and rescue was called the child was uninjured. A deputy conducted a search of the area for the car involved possibly a grey passenger car with a female driver. Independent witnesses state the driver was not driving in a reckless manner at the time of the incident. The child ran across the roadway in between parked vehicles in front of the car. The investigation did not reveal any criminal or traffic violations on behalf of the driver. C2009007439

class.name: ciras.db.Crime

Deputies responded to the scene and observed a vehicle traveling well in excess of the posted speed limit. A deputy activated their emergency equipment to initiate a traffic stop. The vehicle continued to drive before crashing into a tree line. The driver then fled the vehicle and ran into the pond near the Ashburn Village Association Center. The subject swam to the center island. Emergency personnel responded with a boat to apprehend the man. The driver Todd M. Finnerty 26 of Arlington VA was taken to a local hospital for his injuries. He was charged with DUI and released on a summons. Additional charges are pending C2009008436

class.element: Charles H. Popenoe 76 of Bethesda MD was driving a 2004 Toyota Prius when he made a u-turn and struck a westbound 2002 Mercedes driven by Ngan Duong 43 of Ashburn VA.. The crash occurred on Route 7 just east of Goose Creek. Popenoe was airlifted to INOVA Fairfax Hospital where he was later charged with DUI. The crash occurred at approximately 4:51 PM Sunday. C2009010839

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: Leslee Garza 20 of Harpers Ferry WV was driving a 1990 Toyota Corolla westbound on Rt 9 east of the Hillsboro town limits when her vehicle crossed the double yellow line and struck a 2007 Jeep Liberty head-on. The Jeep Liberty was being driven by Lance Benedict 43 of McLean VA. Garza who was not wearing a seat belt was airlifted to INOVA Fairfax Hospital with serious injuries. Benedict and his wife (Renata Benedict) were both taken to INOVA Loudoun Hospital-Leesburg for their injuries.  Garza was charged with DUI. C2009010852

class.element: Deputies responded to the listed location for a report of a possible fight in progress. A 19-year-old Maryland woman reported she was on the river with friends when she was confronted by a male subject who was upset she was holding an alcoholic beverage while pregnant. The victim and her friends left the river and were followed by the subject and his friends. The subject later identified as Dustin James Biss 20 of Maryland allegedly assaulted the victim and damaged the window of the vehicle. Other subjects who were not located also damaged windows of the victimÕs vehicle and assaulted the occupants inside. Biss was charged with assault and battery destruction of property and drunk in public. Biss remains held on a $2000.00 bond. C2009011678

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A deputy observed a vehicle driving on Route 7 with a malfunctioning headlight. The deputy initiated a traffic stop and the vehicle accelerated. The vehicle eventually turned onto Tillman Terrace and pulled into a parking space at Whitford Square. The driver fled on foot. A perimeter was established and a Loudoun SheriffÕs K9 Unit located the suspect hiding in a stairwell. The suspect was identified as a 16-year-old male from Manassas VA. The juvenile whose name cannot be released because he is a minor was charged with felony eluding unauthorized use of a vehicle reckless driving disregarding a stop sign defective headlight and driving on a suspended license. He remains held at the Juvenile Detention Center. C2009014520

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A SheriffÕs Deputy observed a vehicle traveling westbound in the eastbound lanes of Route 7. As the deputy activated their emergency equipment the vehicle quickly turned onto Community Plaza and sped off. A pursuit started and was terminated at the Fairfax County Line. Law enforcement personnel from Fairfax County took over the pursuit as it went southbound on the Fairfax County Parkway. Fairfax deployed stop sticks disabling the vehicle. The vehicle was stopped on the Fairfax County Parkway at Sunrise Valley Drive. Fairfax Police charged the driver with Speed to Elude DUI and DUI Revoked. Charges are pending in Loudoun County. 2009014525

class.element: Around 12:48 p.m. a tire crossed into traffic in the eastbound lanes of traffic on Route 7 just east of Ashburn Village Boulevard. The runaway tire struck three vehicles traveling east on Route 7. Loudoun SheriffÕs Crash Investigators are seeking anyone who may have information on an unknown vehicle carrying loose tires in the area at the time of the incident. If you have information regarding the possible identity of the vehicle you are asked to contact Sgt. K. Robinette at 703-777-737-8374. C2009015896

class.name: ciras.db.Crime
class.element: A resident reported a burglary in progress at their home. The resident returned home and confronted a female suspect. Deputies responded to the scene and took the suspect into custody. The suspect was identified as a 15-year-old from Sterling VA. A second suspect a 14-year-old male also from Sterling VA was identified as being involved in the burglary. He was located and taken into custody. The two are facing juvenile petitions for burglary. The names of the suspects cannot be released due to their age. C2009015766

The driver was described as a Hispanic male 30 to 40-years-old with facial hair. He was wearing a straw cowboy style hat. The female left the area and call her parents. C2009015768

class.element: Several residents were working at a yard sale when an unknown male approached them. The male began to engage in conversation which at one point made them uncomfortable. The subject then exposed himself to a 46-year-old woman. The victim contacted authorities and then went over to the SheriffÕs Office Round Hill station where a deputy was working. The deputy located the subject and interviewed him. Michael Lawrence Culler 40 of Round Hill was charged with indecent exposure. He remains held without bond. C2009016245

class.element: On the listed date an unknown subject entered the Dunkin Donuts at the listed location in Lowes Island. The subject entered the store around 2:30 a.m. with his shirt tied around his face and removed cash from the cash register. The subject re-entered the store an removed cash from a second register. The subject has been identified as Johnnie Christopher Johnson 22 of Sterling VA. He was charged with Burglary and two counts of Grand Larceny.  He is currently being held at the Loudoun County Adult Detention Center without bond. C2009014720
